Class PSOListTools

public class PSOListTools
extends com.percussion.extension.PSJexlUtilBase
implements com.percussion.extension.IPSJexlExpression

This class is a utility class to help create and manipulate lists with JEXL.

Since:

Author:
agent

Method Detail

subListUnSafe

public java.util.List subListUnSafe(java.util.Collection c,
                                    int start,
                                    int end)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                    java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Works just like the java.util.List.subList but with a Collection object. If the arguments are invalid an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
c - the collection.
start - start index (inclusive) for the slice
end - end index (exclusive)
Returns:
a subsection of the collection as a list.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException, - IndexOutOfBoundsException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
See Also:
List.subList(int, int)

sublist

@IPSJexlMethod(description="sublist sections a part of a collection into a list",
               params={@IPSJexlParam(name="collection",description="the collection to be used"),@IPSJexlParam(name="start",description="the start index (negative means count back from the end of the collection)"),@IPSJexlParam(name="end",description="the end index (exclusive)")},
               returns="a subset of collection as a list")
public java.util.List sublist(java.util.Collection c,
                                                                                   int start,
                                                                                   int end)

Gets a sublist from the specified Collection avoiding exceptions.

A negative start position can be used to start/end n objects from the end of the Collection.

The returned sublist starts with the character in the start position and ends before the end position. All position counting is zero-based -- i.e., to start at the beginning of the collection use start = 0. Negative start and end positions can be used to specify offsets relative to the end of the String.

If start is not strictly to the left of end, "" is returned. 

  sublist(null, *, *)    = [];
  sublist([], * ,  *)    = [];
  sublist(["a","b","c"], 0, 2)   = ["a","b"]
  sublist(["a","b","c"], 2, 0)   = []
  sublist(["a","b","c"], 2, 4)   = ["c"]
  sublist(["a","b","c"], 4, 6)   = []
  sublist(["a","b","c"], 2, 2)   = []
  sublist(["a","b","c"], -2, -1) = ["b"]
  sublist(["a","b","c"], -4, 2)  = ["a","b"]

Parameters:
c - the Collection to get the sublist from, may be null
start - the position to start from, negative means count back from the end of the Collection by this many characters
end - the position to end at (exclusive), negative means count back from the end of the Collection by this many characters
Returns:
subset of the collection from start position to end positon, never null.

asList

@IPSJexlMethod(description="Creates a list from an array or collection. If its neither the list will contain just the item.",
               params=@IPSJexlParam(name="value",description="value "),
               returns="a list")
public java.util.List asList(java.lang.Object single)
Creates a list from an array or collection. If its neither the list will contain just the item (list.size()==1).

Parameters:
single - if null returns an empty list.
Returns:
a list representing the array,collection, or single item, never null

asList

@IPSJexlMethod(description="Creates a list of size with given value for each index",
               params={@IPSJexlParam(name="value",description="value "),@IPSJexlParam(name="size",description="size of the array to return")},
               returns="T[]")
public <T> java.util.List<T> asList(T value,
                                                                            int size)
Creates a list of size with the given value for each index.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
value - the value should be repeated on each index.
size - size of the array to return. Invalid sizes return an empty list.
Returns:
an array with the given size, Never null.

asPair

@IPSJexlMethod(description="Creates a PSPair has properties First and Second ",
               params={@IPSJexlParam(name="first",description="first object"),@IPSJexlParam(name="second",description="second object")},
               returns="a list")
public <A,B> com.percussion.utils.types.PSPair<A,B> asPair(A first,
                                                                                                   B second)
Creates a PSPair Object this simply has two properties First and Second. This can be used with $tools.sorter.sort to sort items

Type Parameters:
A,B -
Parameters:
first - the first object.
second - the second object.
Returns:
a PSPair Object, Never null.

reverse

@IPSJexlMethod(description="Reverses the order of the elements in the specified list.",
               params=@IPSJexlParam(name="list",description="the list whose elements are to be reversed."))
public void reverse(java.util.List list)
Reverses the order of the elements in the specified list. Proxies Collections.reverse(java.util.List)

Parameters:
list - the list whose elements are to be reversed. this list must support the set method.
